column4: how can i control/determine which video driver xorg is using?
the xorg.conf file doesn't say much
it doesn't specify antything except for saying Identifier: "default driver" or something like that
but i want to know which driver is being used
so how do i find out?
sudo lshw | less
That gives me the hardware info - which I already know. I want to know which xorg driver is being used.
for what device?
then press q, then run: sudo lshw -C display
read the last line where it says module
thats the exact same output, just outputting the video portion
the first command I gave you shows that as well, you must've not read it
if you wanna look supe smart: sudo lshw -C display | grep driver
I know what that output is and I've read it. But lshw is not what I need - it tells me what my hardware is, but I want to know what display driver xorg is using
that driver IS the one xorg is using
that returns nothing.
lspci -v may help
lspci -v | grep driver
that gives kernel drivers, but thanks I've already found the answer in Xorg.0.log
it was _working_ in 9.10
there's a whole thread and anumber of open bugs about it http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1469340&page=4
